document_data.name: The Raging Lion
document_data.mainbody: The '''Raging Lion''' was an [[inn]] that was located in the city of [[Waterdeep]] during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The inn was located on [[Lion Street]] in the northeastern section of Waterdeep's [[Waterdeep/North Ward|North Ward]].{{Cite interactive atlas|Waterdeep}}
document_data.Description: Much of the interior of the Raging Lion was paneled with dark wood and worn carpets covered the entire floor. ''[[Glowing globe]]s'' illuminated the interior.
document_data.Activities: The inn maintained a strict policy against lighting any flames this included smoking [[tobacco]] products.
document_data.History: The cellar of the Raging Lion was once used as a temple by noble cultists of [[Kambadlan]] the Black Tortoise of Night. This was the source of several Waterdhavian oaths including "by the Black Tortoise!" and "by the shell of Kambadlan!"
document_data.Inhabitants: The Raging Lion was owned by a man named [[Lhaerhlin Masram]]. Several [[dwarves]] and female [[adventurer]]s used the inn as their home. They helped Lhaerhlin maintain order during their stays between outings.
